page.title: 18A day in my life - Part 2
page.content: {A day in my life cont.} A peaceful lunch was followed by reading a chapter or two from my book. I had made a chocolate fudge cake the day before, so I spent an enjoyable half hour decorating it as my birthday cake.This was much appreciated by my children later and some of their young friends who delighted in the impromptu birthday gathering. By early evening the aroma of the strawberries was tantilising, so they were loaded into the car and taken up to the school where they were to form part of the buffet supper at the school barn dance. Our summer of 1985 will not be remembered for it's dry warm evenings but July 12th was one of them.What a happy evening it was. We danced and danced in the playground everyone enjoying the relaxed and jovial atmosphere before wearying homewards.
